relation: Great for these types of students
students who are willing to drive to school everyday, because that takes dedication.
this school is so cheap! the tn lottery scholarship basically covers tuition.
there are a lot of student activitites that are fun. i participated in my first flash mob here!!
the wood campus center has a great cafeteria with a lot of choices. food can sometimes be a little expensive, but it's good quality. there are also a lot of restaurants off campus.
this is a community college, so there is no dorm life.
my classes are very challenging and my professors expect the best out of all of their students.
apply early!! the earlier you apply, to more scholarships you can get and you also get the classtimes that you want. don't be afraid to ask questions.

this is a very good school. although students sometimes go here thinking that they can breeze by and do the miniumun amount of work, the professors here expect a lot from us. you get out of this school what you put into it.
pageTitle: Volunteer State Community College Reviews: Student Reviews and Ratings | Cappex
TableContextTimeStampAfterTable: {14903=Campus police officers are usually patrolling the campus, especially in the mornings, and they will issue tickets for parking violations. I didn't heard of any safety problems on campus for the 2012-2013 school year., 177890=© 2015, Cappex.com, LLC, 47502=Very affordable at only 1000-2000 dollars a semester, depending on how many credit hours you take., 114706=The price per semester is a phenomenal deal. At just under $2000 for 12 credit hours, you will receive a sound education, and a taste of the college experience. It is an unbeatable price, and Volunteer State has not seemed to cut any necessary corners to make it possible.}

textAfterTable: Tips for prospective students Study up! Meaning: This is a good school, however you shouldn't just settle for any school. Choose one that fits what you are looking for and what you need to get out of school. I went through a search of several different schools before I came back to this one. It all depends on what's best for you! Bang for the buck Volunteer State is very affordable. Coming out of high school, I was worried about being able to pay for college myself because my parents didn't have the money to send me. I had thought about going to a bigger school, but then realized how much it would mean I would be paying down the road. I'm not a loans person, myself. So I wanted to find a school that I could afford to pay for myself and not worry about it leaving me in debt. Right now, even with just working during the summer months, I am still able to afford going to school here. While you won't get all the hype in attending a major university, Volunteer State is great for someone looking to get a good education without all the financial worries.
